results.title: Crows and sparrows = Wuya yu maque [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zheng Junli and Kunlun Film Company
results.brief_description: Production of this landmark film began in 1948 but was halted by the Kuomintang authorities when they discovered that the submitted script was not being followed and was heavily anti-KMT. In the interval before it resumed production in September 1949, it was rewritten to be even more hostile to KMT authorities. The film centres on the joys and disasters experienced by the inhabitants of a boarding house comandeered by a KMT official. The film’s basic form is derived from the modern drama tradition of China. The casual naturalism has been compared with neo-realism. Cast includes Zhao Dan, Wu Yin ans Sun Daolin. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Crown of righteousness
results.creator_credit: Norman Walker, Ray Hoke and GHW Production
results.brief_description: Paul’s captivity in Rome. Ephroditus bring him gifts from the Church in Phillippi. A reconstruction of the events relation to St Paul’s re-arrest and hie trial before Nero (2 Timothy IV 7-8).

results.title: Crow boy (K)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A shy boy attending a village school in Japan withdraws into a world of his own until a kind and wise teacher draws him out and his classmates discover his special talent. Based on the book of the same title by Taro Yashima.

results.title: Croupier
results.creator_credit: Mike Hodges, Jonathan Cavendish, Arte, WDR La Sept Cinema, Filmstiftung NRW and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: Mike Hodges’ slow-burning “Croupier” is the tale of one man’s addiction to watching people lose; and whose detached observation of the sleaze and depression in the world of gambling becomes his only means of self-fulfillment. Jack Manfred (Clive Owen) is a former croupier and struggling writer lured back to casino work by his estranged father. Therein he encounters without any real surprise the business of letting people lose, and soon his relationships with those close to him take on a similar sense of self-interest and subtle cruelty. Interwoven with the robberies, intrigue and exoticism is a commentary on the alienation bred by gambling and the lifestyle it entails. Cast also includes Gina McKee, Kate Hardie and Paul Reynolds.

results.title: Crouching tiger hidden dragon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Ligong Xu, Bill Kong, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Zoom Hunt International, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Columbia Pictures and Sony Pictures
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ang Lee, Ligong Xu, Bill Kong, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Zoom Hunt International, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Columbia Pictures and Sony Pictures

results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Jason Camenzuli, Sean Croyston, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.

results.title: Crosstalk
results.creator_credit: Mark Egerton, Errol Sullivan, Filmside Productions and Wall to Wall
results.brief_description: A computer expert crippled in a suspicious accident is now confined to a flat with a nurse. He was originally investigating the malfunctioning of a super computer but now finds himself menaced by the same technology.
